intro: Corydalis graminea, commonly known as the grass larkspur, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Europe. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family, which includes poppies and other flowering plants. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters and has slender, grass-like leaves. Its flowers are usually blue or purple, with two upper petals that are larger than the lower ones. Corydalis graminea is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade.
